stanza.line: Love is my sin and thy dear virtue (a)hate(/a)
Hate of my sin grounded on sinful (b)loving(/b)
O but with mine compare thou thine own (a)state(/a)
And thou shalt find it merits not (b)reproving(/b)
Or if it do not from those lips of (c)thine(/c)
And sealed false bonds of love as oft as (c)mine(/c)
Robbed others' beds' revenues of their (d)rents(/d)
Be it lawful I love thee as thou lov'st (e)those(/e)
Whom thine eyes woo as mine importune (f)thee(/f)
Root pity in thy heart that when it (e)grows(/e)
Thy pity may deserve to pitied (f)be(/f)
If thou dost seek to have what thou dost (g)hide(/g)
